description.narrative: No. of consultations with governmnet and civil sector conducted, Sets of indicators available on county level, No. of disadvantaged youth contacted and no of their individual employment plans developed; No. of reviews, assessments, and county action plans completed.

comment.narrative: Lack of clear mechanisms for financing and contracting social services on central, regional and local level Lack of study on early school leavers and their reintegration into education or labour market.

An analyes of survey-data results prepared as a basis for national strategy and action plan for social benefits system reform Analyes of survey data discussed at 4 regional worksops with local-level social sector actors Action plan drafted for the Ministry Study-tours prepared and held to learn from other EU-member states practice in social benefits local level system

description.narrative: Inclusion of Roma in Medjimurje
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - policy, planning and administration
County Action Plan adopted Community-level support for self-employement secured Capacities of Roma communities to work in project-based environment increased

comment.narrative: Non existing County Action Plan for Roma Inclusion in Medjimurje One activity (pre-school programme) in Family Centre implemented Non existing support programmes for inclusive education for primary school teachers Non existing trainings and support for self-employment initiatives Stereotypes in reporting about Roma in local news

With a newly developed and funded project from EEA-Norway grants programme, 5 more county-level Roma action plans are to be prepared Findings of national Roma strategy and action plan mid-term review used to revise and improve the plan Capacities of Roma civil society organisations further increased in Medjimurje and in Sisak-Moslavina counties

title.narrative: Energy Efficiency in Public and Residential Buildings

description.narrative: PIMS 715 CC: FSP "Croatia - Removing Barriers to Improving Energy Efficiency of Residential and Service Sectors"

description.narrative: Systematic Energy Management in Public Sector Buildings in Croatia - Technical assistance to local communties

description.narrative: independent political entity
Energy - power generation

provider-org.narrative: PROTECTION AND ENERGY EFFICIENCY FUND OF REPUBLIC OF CROATIA
PROTECTION AND ENERGY EFFICIENCY FUND OF REPUBLIC OF CROATIA

description.narrative: number of rural households with newly enabled access to electricity

comment.narrative: - 2005. At the time of starting the UNDP-GEF EE Project six years ago (in 2006), there was an incomplete legal framework in the area of energy efficiency in Croatia. There were insufficient human and technical resources for energy management in the public sector, the majority of data regarding buildings owned or used by cities, counties and ministries were incomplete, and provided no information on energy consumption and the cost of thereof. There was a general absence of energy management in buildings, insufficient awareness of energy efficiency as an energy source, and inadequate knowledge on energy efficient products and technologies. - 2013: There are still rural households in Croatia with no electricity access. Some analysis show that there are approximately 126 villages with more than 500 houses of mostly war returnees that are not connected to the public electricity grid.

develop a registry of rural households that live with no electricity access (based on different databases and checked in the field) developa methodology to use renewable energy resources to provide electricity access work on partnerships with regional governemnts and financial instiuttions to ensure electrification of at least 20 rural households

Registry prepared, covers 5 counties and roughly 40 households Methodology developed, shows the use of solar pover is 10 or more times cost-effective then traditional electrification with electricity grid extension Partnerships developed in 3 counties and Croatian Fund for Environment and Energy Efficiency for co-financing The first 5 systems installed in one county on rural househlds 10 more systems for rural households are in hard pipeline for installation by the end of 2015

description.narrative: Supporting Croatia`s transition to low-emission development
independent political entity

activity-description.narrative: Workshops, detecting pilot projects for community energy, calls for green public procurement, support to renewable energy project developers

description.narrative: Low-emission development strategy for Croatia prepared Technical and instituitonal capacities increased through different pilot-projects that demostrate low-carbon development in practice

comment.narrative: Weak technical and institutional capacities that are able to plan for and to create a roadmap for low-carbon and climate resilient development of Croatia. There is no low-emission development strategy for Croatia.

National low-emission development strategy prepared and promoted within "Road to COP 21 in Paris" outreach initatives City of Zagreb low-carbon development roadmap process continues and engage more citisen initatives School in Kastela finalises the installation and is energy-independent as a pilot-project i.e. good model for other schools

description.narrative: The sustainable local development programme aims at creating conditions for socio-economic recovery in war-affected areas and other underdeveloped regions, in part by supporting preparations for effective use of EU funds.
Support to underdeveleped areas of Croatia to prepare for the EU CAP and Rural Development Policy while reducing their vulnerability to Climate Change

description.narrative: policy, planning and administration
- increased No of development projects ready for implementation and applying for EU and other development funds - increased No of LAGs and capacities within

comment.narrative: - low absorption capacity of EU funds in rural areas, no project ideas elaborated - no Local Action Groups (LAG) established with capacities to use EU funds

- catalogue of 30 rural development projects developed with 15 project ideas elaborated for EU funding - database of 100 rural stakeholders in Zadar county developed, as a basis for furhter programming and projects preprarion to be funded from rural development funds - Sign of quality and visual identity of agricultural and other rural products of Zadar County prepared

description.narrative: PIMS 4731: Strengthening the Institutional and Financial Sustainability of the National Protected Area System (Croatia)_PARCS project
Improving current institutional framework for national protected areas; improving financial sustainability of national protected areas to ensure they have adequate financial resources.
independent political entity

activity-description.narrative: The project focuses on "national protected areas" (NPA) that include 8 National Parks and 11 Nature Parks located throughout Croatia. First project component is focused on overall improvement of protected area system in Croatia. Second project component is focused on implementation of specific proje

description.narrative: Energy - policy, planning and administration

1. Financial sustainability scorecard for national system of protected areas - tool used for all GEF protected areas projects, contains financial data 2. Capacity development indicator score for protected area system 3. Annual financing gap of the ‘optimal management scenario’ for national protected areas (US$) 4. Management Effectiveness Tracking Tool scorecard (METT average): All national PAs National Parks Nature Parks 5. Degree of conservation for the Natura 2000 target species and habitats in national protected areas

comment.narrative: 1. 32% (financial data 2011/2012) 2. Systemic: 58% Institutional: 57% Individual: 46% 3. US$14.7m 4. All national PAs: 63% National Parks: 62% Nature Parks: 64% 5. Species: A – 184 B – 214 C – 14 Habitats: A – 94 B – 91 C – 8

Targets are set for end-of-project (2017) and is difficult to derive annual targets as most targets should be result of complex multi-annual project activities with beneficiaries (protected areas). 1. Financial sustainability scorecard for national system of protected areas end-of project target is: 45% or higher 2. Capacity development indicator score for protected area system Systemic: 67% Institutional: 77% Individual: 72% 3. Annual financing gap of the ‘optimal management scenario’ for national protected areas end-of-project target: less then $5 million 4. Management Effectiveness Tracking Tool scorecard (average): All national PAs: 67% or higher National Parks: 67% or higher Nature Parks: 67% or higher 5. Degree of conservation for the Natura 2000 target species and habitats in national protected areas - stays the same or improves at the end of project
targets are aimed for end-of-project in 2017

description.narrative: Reforming the institutional framework to strengthen the management effectiveness of national protected areas
Strategic plan and management guidelines for national protected areas approved.

comment.narrative:
Strategic plan: None
Management guidelines: Partial, but incomplete

Strategic plan: Yes
Management guidelines: Complete

It is not possible to calculate target level at this reporting period.
It is expected that Nature protection law and NBSAP will be adopted by the Government in September 2015. Having strategic guidance in the two most important documents will provide guidance for development of a national planning framework for the protected area system. Upon this, strategic plan and management guidelines for national protected areas will be developed and adopted.
